guide.introduction: You will use simple drill, cutting skills on PVC pipe with a few screws to raise the bar on your video capture needs.
guide.introduction_rendered:
You will use simple drill, cutting skills on PVC pipe with a few screws to raise the bar on your video capture needs.

Relevant parts
  • 3/4"x 1-2' PVC
  • 1 1-1/2"x 6"
  • 1 2"x 7" PVC
  • 1x2" lumber 2'
Tools
  • 9/32" wood drill bit
  • Electric or Hand Saw
  • Utility knife
  • aerosol paint
  • hand electric drill

lines.text: Weigh your camera -- you need the a little more weight as the camera your going to use below the fulcrum.
lines.text_raw: Weigh your camera -- you need the a little more weight as the camera your going to use below the fulcrum.

lines.text: the more distance you add below the fulcrum the less weight you need. -- camera=10.9 oz. (310g)  below fulcrum 24in. + 8.8oz. ~ 9 oz. = 126inch-ounce of torque
lines.text_raw: the more distance you add below the fulcrum the less weight you need. -- camera=10.9 oz. (310g)  below fulcrum 24in. + 8.8oz. ~ 9 oz. = 126inch-ounce of torque

lines.text: measure and mark your cuts that you calculated or eyeball it like I did on my first one
lines.text_raw: measure and mark your cuts that you calculated or eyeball it like I did on my first one

lines.text: create a camera mount. anything from using a tripod quick release shoe (like me) to sliding mounts.
lines.text_raw: create a camera mount.  anything from using a tripod quick release shoe (like me) to [http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=sr_st?keywords=sliding+quick+release+plate&qid=1361073945&rh=k%3Asliding+quick+release+plate%2Cn%3A172282&sort=price|sliding mounts].

lines.text: make sure on the gimbal (where the haddle attaches to the upright tube) not to tighten the screws all the way so it can pivot freely.
lines.text_raw: make sure on the gimbal (where the haddle attaches to the upright tube) not to tighten the screws all the way so it can pivot freely.

lines.text: Ballance -- attache your camera and count how many seconds it takes to fall. 2-3 perfect, less than 1=too heavy use less weight, 3 or more=too light use more weight.
